result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Gerald Gerke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: With any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served.

records.addlTxt:
Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.

Plea hearing held

AS TO COUNT *
Defendant changes her/his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her/his plea, advised of her/his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if s/he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her/his rights.    Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.    Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge.



AS TO COUNT *
Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered COUNT * DISMISSED as a matter of law.

AS TO COUNT* 
Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered COUNT*  DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.


Documents received and filed.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum and Jury Instructions/Elements of the offense 
Victim Impact Statement

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 31

CASE RECALLED. SAME APPEARANCES.

In chambers discussion placed on the record. Parties wishes to vacate jury trial. Defense requesting to matter proceed to a plea and sentencing hearing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court ordered defendant to serve 5 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served. 

Court ordered DNA sample to be taken and DNA assessment to be paid. Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges by April 13, 2017, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered defendant's 10 days consecutive on failure to pay ordered executed on case # 14CF1526.
.
20 day appeal 

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Brandon Gerald Gerke in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Brandon Gerald Gerke in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rifelj, Br. 31. Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Brandon Gerald Gerke in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Brandon Gerald Gerke in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
